title: For A Society Without Jobs
body: james livingston  in his new book   no more work   directly confronts the issue of socially necessary work with what he calls socially beneficial work  a somewhat slippery concept the former faces the same forces of routinization  speed-up and  finally  elimination like many jobs  whereas the latter retains its desirability   as meaningful work   even though it is often valueless as a source of compensation   for a critical  sympathetic  review of livingston's book  see here http dissidentvoice org 2017 02 for-a-society-without-jobs
